payload.h2: Smart Citizen is a movement for civic participation in a modern world
payload.h4: Smart Citizen creates open tools for citizens to be better informed about the world around them.
This sensor is a Smart Citizen Kit for environmental sensing. It measures sound, air quality, humidity, and lots of other things
The kit sends all the measurements to the Smart Citizen website. It's open and free for all to see, question and play with...
There's a few pieces we need to set up the Kit, let's check we have them all

payload.h2: Click on all the things you have received
payload.h4: We need to know this to make the set up work smoothly
payload.part1_desc: This is where all the sensors are. It connects to the bigger, hardware board, so that the sensors can transmit what they find.
payload.part2_desc: This is where all the computation takes place. Anytime you want to connect something to the Smart Citizen, it will be on this board
payload.part3_desc: This powers the device. Every so often it has to be recharged, especially after long periods of continuous use.
payload.part4_desc: When the Kit needs to be charged, you can connect this cable to your computer or plug, and back to the Kit.

payload.h4: You donâ€™t have to have the case, but it does protect your kit against the elements
payload.part5_desc: The case is water resistant and allows the device to be affixed to a variety of surfaces.
payload.part6_desc: Placed between the hardware board and sensor board, this keeps the boards study.
payload.part7_desc: Closing the case, this is used dto protect the device from rain. Make sure to place the holes over the sound sensor.
payload.part8_desc: This is used to fasten the case to the cover.

payload.h4: Now let's put it all together

payload.text: Place a spacer in the holes on the sensor board
Connect the pins on the sensor board to the hardware board
Connect the battery to the hardware board

payload.h2: And finally, turn on the Kit
payload.text: Push the button on the Kit multiple times, until the LED is red.

payload.h2: Next, we'll place it all in the casing
payload.text: Make sure you place it with the battery cable towards the bottom of the casing

payload.h2: ... and to finish, seal the cover
payload.text: Place the transparent plastic on the front of the case and fix it in place with the two white plugs.

payload.h4: Time to connect it to the internet
